sentences: Fritz Crome  (6 May 1879 â€“ 25 April 1948) was a Danish composer and music writer.
Fritz Crome was the son of August Crome, who founded the store Crom & Goldschmidt in Copenhagen.
He trained as a pianist with Louis Glass and later studied in Paris and Berlin.
He was then employed at the Stern Conservatory in Berlin, while he worked as a music writer, both in Germany and Scandinavia.
From 1925 until his death he was employed as a teacher at the Royal Danish Academy of Music.
It included all the songs that were inspired by Hugo Wolf, notably.
